body.p:
Piketon, Ky. Dec. 9th '65
To His Excellency
Gov Bramlette

An Indictment for Tippling was found at the present term of our Circuit Court against James Black -- a colored man -- &, although he could really have demurred the same out of Court, on account of his not being a free man, but as this might have prejudiced him in an other important matter, he did not choose thus to gratify those who were instrumental in indicting him, & went into court & confessed, & now throws himself upon the mercy of your excellency for pardon.

The undersigned vouch for his character as an upright, industrious, & really respected black man -- being an exception from the majority of his race, in all the elements of a good citizen, & believeing, & knowing the liquor to have been sold under peculiar circumstances through the agency of white men takeing advantage of him, they ask your excellency to remit the fine.
I fully endorse the Above Statement & Petition

J. S. Dury
Comth Atty.
A. E. Adams
John Dils Jr

Pike Circuit Ct
vs
James Black
$60,
Tipling
Remitted 16 Dec/65
